alert.note: Alert for Berrien; Brooks; Colquitt; Cook; Grady; Lanier; Lowndes; Mitchell; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 22 at 1:55PM EDT until July 22 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Cook County in south central Georgia... Northeastern Grady County in southwestern Georgia... Berrien County in south central Georgia... Lanier County in south central Georgia... Southeastern Mitchell County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Lowndes County in south central Georgia... Northern Thomas County in south central Georgia... Northwestern Brooks County in south central Georgia... Colquitt County in south central Georgia... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 155 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Alapaha to near Pelham, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Nashville, Moultrie, Adel, Thomasville, Lakeland, Pelham, Cairo, Camilla, Hahira, Sparks, Ray City, Norman Park, Lenox, Ochlocknee, Pavo, Coolidge, Riverside, Moody Air Force Base, Schley and Meigs. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Berrien; Brooks; Colquitt; Cook; Grady; Lanier; Lowndes; Mitchell; Thomas
